thread.title: Killeen ISD theatre students set records at Texas Thespian State Festival
thread.title_full: Killeen ISD theatre students set records at Texas Thespian State Festival

author: Jacob Wallin
title: Killeen ISD theatre students set records at Texas Thespian State Festival
text:
KILLEEN, Texas — Students from [Killeen ISD](https://www.killeenisd.org/)'s theatre program made district history this November at the [Texas Thespian State Festival](https://www.texasthespians.org/) in Grapevine.
Multiple students earned top marks in various categories, several for the first time in district history, as well as receiving a record amount of scholarship offers, said Killeen ISD.
According to Killeen ISD, students from [Ellison](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/ehs), [Harker Heights](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/hhhs) and [Chaparral](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/Page/115) High Schools helped achieve the milestones, with 14 earning superior scores from all three judges in their respective events and advancing to the [National Thespys](https://schooltheatre.org/thespys/) competition.
Students who qualified for the National Thespys are:
- Junior Michael Manley – Harker Heights High School – Monologue
- Junior Ava Morgan – Chaparral High School – Monologue
- Junior Kaitlyn Dooley – Chaparral High School – Monologue
- Junior Xiana Melendez – Chaparral High School – Monologue
- Senior Asher Harris and Junior Marlee Luther – Chaparral High School – Duet Acting
- Junior Armie Melton – Chaparral High School – Solo Musical
- Junior Jessiel Rosario and Henry Kreinbrink – Chaparral High School – Duet Musical
- Juniors Hadassah Moon and Zachary Repine – Chaparral High School – Duet Musical
- Senior Olivia Hopson – Ellison High School – Makeup Design
- Senior Emely Fernandez – Chaparral High School – Lighting Design
These students are now reportedly invited to compete at the [International Thespian Festival](https://schooltheatre.org/event/international-thespian-festival-2024/) at Indiana University in June 2025.
Juniors and seniors from the program also reportedly received over 160 college callbacks and secured more than $333,000 in scholarship offers, the highest amount in Killeen ISD history.
Some of the other notable achievements include:
*Indicates a first in Killeen ISD history
- Junior Kaitlyn Dooley – Chaparral High School – Improv Challenge All-Star Performer*
- Junior Armie Melton – Chaparral High School – State Student Thespian Officer Candidate
- Junior Ava Morgan – Chaparral High School – Mainstage Callback Performer, Perfect Score*
- Junior Armie Melton – Chaparral High School – Mainstage Callback Performer, Perfect Score*
- Senior Emely Fernandez – Chaparral High School – $1,000 Texas Thespian Scholarship Recipient*
According to Killeen ISD, the Texas Thespian State Festival provides opportunities to experience live theatre from across the state, participate in workshops, audition for colleges and employers and compete in individual events.
“We commend our theatre directors for their dedication and support in making these opportunities possible for our students,” Morganne Davies, assistant director for Fine Arts, said. “We look forward to continued growth and increased participation in the years ahead."
